page.title: 01Chetnole and Leigh disrict
page.content: The area is largely made up of intensively managed farmland for the production of milk. There is a small amount of arable, some of which is used for straw which is then used for thatching reed. The woodland was decidious, but has been feuded and replanted with coniferous. The block is in the south west corner of the blackmoor vale and is generally very flat. The land rises up upon the the eastern boundary and is of less good quality. Cheinole and Leigh are basically farming villages but many residents commute to Yeovil and Sherborne to work. The villages attract many retired people who leave the home counties to reside in the country. The majority of houses are built of stone, but the newer houses are of reconstitutes stone, but the newer houses are of reconstitued
